com.github.wuic.nut
Class AbstractNutDao

java.lang.Object
  com.github.wuic.util.PollingScheduler<NutDaoListener>
      com.github.wuic.nut.AbstractNutDao
All Implemented Interfaces:
NutDao, Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
HttpNutDao, PathNutDao
public abstract class AbstractNutDao
extends PollingScheduler<NutDaoListener>
implements NutDao

An abstract implementation of a NutDao. As any implementation should provides it, this class defines a base path when retrieved nuts, a set of proxies URIs and a polling feature.

The class is designed to be thread safe.

Since:
0.3.1
Version:
1.4
Author:
Guillaume DROUET

Constructor Detail

AbstractNutDao

public AbstractNutDao(String base,
                      Boolean basePathAsSysProp,
                      String[] proxies,
                      int pollingSeconds,
                      Boolean contentBasedHash)

Builds a new instance.

Parameters:
base - prefix for all paths (a BadArgumentException is thrown is null
basePathAsSysProp - true if the base path is a system property
proxies - proxy URIs serving the nut
pollingSeconds - interval in seconds for polling feature (-1 to disable)
contentBasedHash - true if version number is computed from nut content, false if based on timestamp
Method Detail

run

public void run()

Specified by:
run in interface Runnable

getVersionNumber

protected Future<Long> getVersionNumber(String path)
                                 throws StreamException

Gets the version number for the Nut the given path.

If the contentBasedVersionNumber value related to ApplicationConfig.CONTENT_BASED_VERSION_NUMBER is true, then the content is read to compute the hash value. Howeber, it uses the last modification timestamp.

Parameters:
path - the nut's path
Returns:
the version number
Throws:
StreamException - if version number could not be computed

create

public List<Nut> create(String pathName,
                        NutDao.PathFormat format)
                 throws StreamException

Creates a list of nuts thanks to the given path.

A NutDao.PathFormat also gives information on the format used in the string representation of the given path.

Specified by:

proxyUriFor

public String proxyUriFor(Nut nut)

Returns an URI in a String representation of a proxy serving the given nut.

If many proxies are defined, proxy URI is selected in a round-robin mode. Each time a proxy is used, it won't be reused until all other proxies have been used too.

Specified by:
proxyUriFor in interface NutDao
Parameters:
nut - the nut
Returns:
the proxy URI, null if not proxy is set

save

public void save(Nut nut)

Saves the give nut. An UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown if the implementation supports only nut access.

Specified by:
save in interface NutDao
Parameters:
nut - the nut to save

saveSupported

public Boolean saveSupported()

Indicates if this DAO is able to save a nut, which depends on the underlying protocol.

Specified by:
saveSupported in interface NutDao
Returns:
true if NutDao.save(Nut) is supported, false otherwise

computeRealPaths

public List<String> computeRealPaths(String pathName,
                                     NutDao.PathFormat format)
                              throws StreamException

Returns a list of paths depending of the behavior of the dao with the given path. In fact, the dao could consider the path as a regex, a directory, etc.

Parameters:
pathName - the path access
format - the path format
Returns:
the resulting real paths
Throws:
StreamException - if an I/O error occurs when creating the nut
